review:
I have spent over 800 hours on this game. About 500 hours on Xbox, and about 300 hours on PC. It was one of my favourite games ever.

I downloaded this on Steam literally just to transfer the achievements that I earned on PC (for some reason the achievements don't transfer from Xbox despite it being the exact same Battle.net account?) and I have no further intent to play the game ever again.

Updates for Overwatch slowed down drastically in 2019 and effectively stopped in early 2020, while the fanbase allowed Blizzard to spend their time working on Overwatch 2. They then release the underwhelming Overwatch 2 PVP late last year, which effectively removed all progression. No more levels, pretty much no more earning items. Playing very casually since the day Overwatch 2 released, I never managed to save up the credits for even a single legendary skin, whereas playing Overwatch I would leave the average session with a legendary skin or even sometimes two.

The only thing that kept me excited was the PVE content, just for them to suddenly bin their plans in exchange for something much worse. Instead of the release of one massive single-player campaign with fairly expansive skill trees for one big payment, three story missions are released at a time for £13 with no sort of skill tree to help them feel any different to the Archives events but this time you get to give the greedy, abusive corporation money! 

This game really had my heart at one point, and I have made so many great memories with friends through it, but it's definitely time for me to leave it behind. Corporate greed has ruined this game.

Score: -100/10

Overwatch was so good back then 6 years ago. What happened? Blizzard became greedy and one of the most disgusting and incompetent company in videogame industry.

Micro/Macrotransactions - I'm sorry but paying $20 for single skin is such scummy behaviour. People that bought the game before didn't get basically anything (no veteran status, nothing). You can get a skin for playing, but it will take you a lot of weeks to earn coins through weekly challenges. We hated lootboxes but it's was the golden era in this mess. And forget about those coins from one of the worst implemented battlepasses I've ever seen.

Toxic community - you can say this is not the game's fault but with constant balance changes and shadow fixes, skills become inconsistent and sometimes buggy, most of us players don't know what to expect. People swearing and being mean in chat when you may not have your best day and then immediately report you for you being toxic, following your account being silenced is just trash. Oh and when you're silenced and cannot chat, you get reported too for not cooperating with the team :) visious circle. How toxic? Well I decided to go to voice chat, guy was threating to go to my house and R word my girlfriend. Family friendly community indeed. But of course Blizzard won't do anything about that.

But I was patient, the new PVE mode was about to be released (after numerous delays) with character and abilty progression. That was the main reason they put the 2 after Overwatch. Guess what - first, they scratched it all and instead released PVE small missions (3) for $15. And no this is not a "license to play PVE", this is only for first 3 missions. The audacity is immeasurable. 

It's obvious Blizzard has not a clue what they're doing. Not to mention company's accusations about sexual harrasment (with evidence and even a suicide because of it). 

The only good thing about the game is... maybe the graphics, which is highly subjective. "Fun good" became "fun bad" or even "fun boring bad". Don't recommend this game, it's expensive even for free.

Wish Blizzard just the worst, all others the best!

EDIT: It's so nice seeing this game receiving honest reviews and digging their overwhelmingly negative review pit.

多彩なスキルのヒーローが戦うMOBA寄りのチーム戦FPS。
他の有名所FPSと比べて交戦距離が近く(0-30m)、近接戦が好きな人におすすめ。
MOBA並に暴言が多いのでチャットはOFF推奨（グループチャットを除く）。それだけで上品で平和なゲームに変わります。味方への連絡はping機能を使いましょう。

[h1] ■良い点[/h1]
・動作が軽い。設定でFSRをONにすればAPUでも動作する。
・ショットガンや近接武器が活躍しやすく近いので的が大きい。
・操作感が全く異なる多彩なヒーロー達。だいたいのヒーローに出番がある。
・高低差が大きいステージが多く立体的な戦いが楽しめる。
・敵の一角を崩した後の追撃掃討戦がとても楽しい。
・タンクを橋頭堡にして味方と協力して前線を押し上げる感覚が楽しめる。MMOやラグビーに近い感覚。
・ストーリームービーのクォリティが高い。Youtubeで視聴できます。

[h1]■悪い点[/h1]
・一人一人の責任が重い。4人対5人 ではまず勝てないゲームバランスのため、味方に不満を抱きがち。
・味方と役割を分担して協力するのが前提のデザインのため、味方に必要以上に期待しがち。そして期待と現実の差が大きいと怒りの感情に変わり暴言の原因になる。
・タンクロールは重要かつ敵の攻撃を浴び続けてストレスが溜まりやすい。たまに試合中に精神崩壊を起こして徘徊しているのを見かける。
・他のゲームから引用してしまったスナイパー職。たびたびゲームバランス的に悪さをする。
・一部ヒーローのアンロックに時間がかかる

[h1]■途中で投げ出さないための三カ条[/h1]
・チャットはOFF
・味方への期待を手放す
・勝利に執着しない。上達することを楽しむ

[hr][/hr] 
[h1]■まとめ[/h1]
色々不満はあれどゲームの核となる部分は完成度が高く良くできています。大人数FPSのお祭り騒ぎも良いけれど、もうちょっと濃密な対戦がしたい人におすすめ。

People love to hate this game, I don't agree with everything Team 4 does, and definitely don't agree with how Blizzard does things, but there's a reason I have 5000+ hours in this game and it's because there's genuinely no other game that comes close, nothing else that makes my neurons fire the same way. This game is my coping mechanism for my mental health issues. We are some of the most undesirable humans on this planet, but this game is a safespace for us. Nothing beats rolling out of bed and immediately start spam q'ing comp, the thrill of the climb, the despair of losing your rank. This game is outstanding, but only if you're mentally ill & strong willed.

People reviewing this as not recommended are clearly jumping on the Reddit bandwagon. The game is free, try it out yourself with an open mind. 

I bought this game in 2017 for the full price. I am not salty it is now free. The micro-transactions people are complaining about is due to cosmetics. There is no P2W at all. 

Plus if you use Microsoft Rewards, you can get the Battlepass for free every season. I haven't spent a single penny and have had the premium battle pass every season for free.
